data.entry_key: the key for this entry data

data.file_context: domain for the file (the auth string, sort of)
data.name: a reference name for the file
data.ref: if applicable, json object of parent names for this file

data.file_type_name: The name of the file type.

insertion_info.DESC: additional info for entry in file as a json object

FIELDS.orderedEntry: number giving an ordered subsection section for this entry (optional)
FIELDS.taggedEntry: string giving a tagged subsection for this entry (optional)

data.file_context: the cid for the file (as an auth string)
data.name: a reference name for the file
data.ref: currently used to indicate legacy or normal meta data

data.com_file_id: the com file for this entry
data.meta_file_id: the meta file that composes this entry
data.file_group: json array of strings for the file usage

data.entry_namee: the display name of this entry
data.entry_key: the lookup name of this entry

STYLE SECTION.t: text color (alternative to label style - deprecated)
STYLE SECTION.zmin: min zoom scale to show object

ICON SECTION.rurl: relative url (to iurl) fro image or icon DEPRECATE THIS

data.entry_name: a display name for the entry:
a display name for this entry

entry_data.legacyProps: map of key vbalue pairs, legacy values
entry_data.color: the color corresponding to this entry

data.entry_name: a display name for this entry

entry_data.keyType: the key type - geometry, entity or address. FOR NOW only one allowed.
entry_data.path: an array of key value pairs. The value may be omitted if 'any' is acceptable. FOR NOW, only do this at the end of the path.
entry_data.legacyPath: an array path in legacy values

LABEL SECTION ENTRY.r: the reference value (not used for type 0)
LABEL SECTION ENTRY.trans: flag to translate the ref value - for text label only. (optional)

STYLE SECTION ENTRY.n: name of the style entry from the theme file

data.entry_name: the display name for this entry
data.entry_key: the looup name for this entry

entry_data.name: name for feature type
entry_data.extends: parent entry name that is extended (optional)
entry_data.modifies: parent entry name that is modified (optional)
entry_data.deletes: parent entry name that is deleted (optional)

properties.DESC: Properties for this type of object.

type.DESC: type of property, text valued from, options below

ENTRY FORMAT.description: A description of this value entry. (optional)

type.DESC: like an enum, but there is an individual preset entry for each value

conditional.DESC: This is a key whose properties are conditional on the value of other properties.

ADDITIONAL FIELDS.conditionalKey: The key on which the option will be selected
ADDITIONAL FIELDS.cases: A map of values, each including a key definition to use in this case.
ADDITIONAL FIELDS.default: A key definition to use if no valid cases are present. If there is no default, no key is used.

multikey.DESC: multiple keys, one of which may be selected

ADDITIONAL FIELDS.options: an aray of key definitions to select from

ADDITIONAL FIELDS.has_lang: the property value is language specific
ADDITIONAL FIELDS.is_array: the input allows an array of values

fixed.DESC: a constant value. These fields are required.

ADDITIONAL FIELDS.value: The value for this fixed property

named_entry.DESC: a reference to a named group of properties

ENTRY FORMAT.prop: a list of properties for this property

action.DESC: instruction for how to apply property

OPTIONS.create: This means create a new entry (default - no need to use this entry)
OPTIONS.replace: This entry replace an existing property of the same name
OPTIONS.modify: This entry modifies an existing property of the same name.
OPTIONS.delete: This entry deletes an existing property of the same name

ENTRY FORMAT.legacyKey: Used in multikeys that are being converted. This is the legacy key.
ENTRY FORMAT.altKey: Used for geom when mulitple old multikeys were combined to a single feature type.
ENTRY FORMAT.legacyValue: Used in multikeys that are being converted. This is the legacy value.
